item.title: Random Axe/Pickaxe breaking pi
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

Just use the conditional or operators (||). Also,[quote]if(c.playerHasItem == axeIds); Change the semicolon to a curly bracket.

item.title: Random Axe/Pickaxe breaking pi
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“mrnessie, post:1, topic:526411”]hey guys im codig random axe breaking and pickaxe breaking on my server, i was wondering i this is correct way… im on phone so cant test. i wrote it on my phone aswell… heres the codes:

if (Misc.random(100) == 0) {
if(c.playerHasItem == axeIds);
			c.getItems().deleteItems(axeIds, 1);
			c.getItems().addItems(494, 1);
			return;
		}
if (Misc.random(100) == 0) {
if(c.playerHasItem == pickaxeIds);
			c.getItems().deleteItems(pickaxeIds, 1);
			c.getItems().addItems(468, 1);
			return;
		}

the arrays:

public int axeIds[] = {1349, 1351, 1353, 1355, 1357, 1359, 1361};
public int pickaxeIds[] = {};

thanks guys,[/quote]

Okay well first your not even checking if their wearing the item, so if they were wearing an axe for example nothing would break.

Read full topic

item.title: Random Axe/Pickaxe breaking pi
item.dc:creator: @mrnessie mrnessie
item.description:
@mrnessie wrote:

hey guys im codig random axe breaking and pickaxe breaking on my server, i was wondering i this is correct way… im on phone so cant test. i wrote it on my phone aswell… heres the codes:

if (Misc.random(100) == 0) {
if(c.playerHasItem == axeIds);
			c.getItems().deleteItems(axeIds, 1);
			c.getItems().addItems(494, 1);
			return;
		}
if (Misc.random(100) == 0) {
if(c.playerHasItem == pickaxeIds);
			c.getItems().deleteItems(pickaxeIds, 1);
			c.getItems().addItems(468, 1);
			return;
		}

the arrays:

public int axeIds[] = {1349, 1351, 1353, 1355, 1357, 1359, 1361};
public int pickaxeIds[] = {};

thanks guys,
